alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 8:41AM CDT until October 27 at 2:38AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut Creek near Mansfield. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek through Mansfield, downstream of Joe Pool Lake. At 22 feet, Retta Road, North Street, Walnut Creek Road, and Magnolia Road are all flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 20.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
